methodology: Backend AI reasoning via GitHub Copilot - using EXACT same hero prompts as GPT-5 for fair comparison
system_instructions: You are an expert at composing execution plans for Calendar.AI prompts using a validated set of canonical unit tasks. Analyze the user prompt, SELECT the canonical tasks needed (from the 24), SEQUENCE them in logical execution order. Only use task IDs from the canonical library. Include CAN-04 (NLU) as first step for almost all prompts. Consider dependencies: CAN-07 enables child tasks, CAN-01 precedes CAN-06. Be specific about what each task contributes to solving the prompt.

compositions.prompt: Show me my pending invitations and which ones I should prioritize based on my priorities for this week: customer meetings and product strategy.

execution_plan.description: Extract user priorities ('customer meetings', 'product strategy') and time constraint ('this week')
execution_plan.note: Universal first step - parse intent and constraints

execution_plan.description: Retrieve pending calendar invitations for current week with RSVP status filter
Classify meetings by type to match against user priorities (customer vs internal)
Rank invitations based on alignment with stated priorities
execution_plan.note: Core requirement: 'prioritize based on my priorities'

orchestration.error_handling: Fallback to showing all invitations if classification fails

compositions.prompt: I have some important meetings this week—flag the ones I need to prep for, and put time on my calendar to prepare.

execution_plan.description: Extract intent: 'flag meetings needing prep' + 'schedule prep time', timeframe: 'this week'
Retrieve important meetings for this week
Assess which meetings are truly important and likely need prep
Extract agendas, attachments, attendee lists to determine prep needs
Estimate how much prep time needed for each meeting
Parse meeting times and find available slots before each meeting for prep
Create prep time blocks on calendar before flagged meetings
execution_plan.note: Fulfills 'put time on my calendar to prepare'

execution_plan.description: Suggest which meetings need prep and optimal prep schedule
execution_plan.note: Present findings to user for confirmation

parallelization_opportunities: step 3 and step 4 can run in parallel
orchestration.error_handling: If prep time estimation fails, use default 30min blocks

compositions.prompt: Show me patterns in the kinds of meetings that fill up my week, and suggest ways to reclaim some time.

execution_plan.description: Extract intent: 'show patterns' + 'suggest ways to reclaim time'
Retrieve historical meeting data (several weeks) to identify patterns
execution_plan.note: Need sufficient history for pattern analysis

execution_plan.description: Classify meetings by type to identify 'kinds of meetings'
execution_plan.note: Core requirement: 'patterns in kinds of meetings'

execution_plan.description: Aggregate meetings by type, frequency, duration to identify patterns
Rank meeting types by value to identify low-value candidates
Create visual representation of meeting patterns
Suggest specific actions: decline recurring low-value meetings, delegate, shorten

orchestration.error_handling: If visualization unavailable, provide text summary

compositions.prompt: Land a weekly 30min 1:1 with Sarah for me, afternoons preferred, avoid Fridays. If her schedule changes, automatically find a new time.

execution_plan.description: Extract constraints: weekly, 30min, Sarah, afternoons preferred, avoid Fridays, auto-reschedule
Resolve 'Sarah' to specific directory entry, get calendar access
execution_plan.note: May need disambiguation if multiple Sarahs

execution_plan.description: Retrieve both user's and Sarah's calendars for availability checking
execution_plan.note: Requires permission to access Sarah's calendar

execution_plan.description: Find mutually available 30min afternoon slots excluding Fridays
Create weekly recurrence pattern for the 1:1
Create recurring 1:1 meeting with Sarah
Monitor Sarah's schedule for conflicts with the recurring 1:1
execution_plan.note: Required for 'if her schedule changes' detection

execution_plan.description: Automatically reschedule when conflicts detected

orchestration.error_handling: If auto-reschedule fails, notify user for manual intervention

compositions.prompt: Bump all my meetings that can move to later in the week, I need to focus today and tomorrow.

execution_plan.description: Extract intent: reschedule movable meetings, timeframes: 'today/tomorrow' → 'later in week'
Retrieve meetings scheduled for today and tomorrow
Assess which meetings 'can move' - identify reschedulable vs critical
Find available slots later in the week for bumped meetings
Optimize rescheduling: minimize attendee conflicts, respect preferences
Update meetings to new later times, send update notifications

orchestration.error_handling: If no valid slots found, prompt user to adjust constraints

compositions.prompt: I have a weekly team-sync on Tuesdays at 2pm. My 1:1s with my manager take priority and can bump it. Book a room.

execution_plan.description: Extract: existing team-sync (Tuesdays 2pm), priority rule (manager 1:1s bump it), resource need (room)
Retrieve the existing team-sync and manager 1:1 meetings
Parse Tuesday 2pm time slot and check for conflicts
Implement priority rule: manager 1:1s can preempt team-sync
Find and book conference room for team-sync
Update team-sync with room booking, implement priority rule

parallelization_opportunities: step 5 room booking can run parallel with step 4
orchestration.error_handling: If no room available, suggest alternate times or virtual option

compositions.prompt: Prep an agenda for my next meeting with the Project Alpha team. Pull in updates from their work.

execution_plan.description: Extract intent: prep agenda, target: Project Alpha team, content: work updates
execution_plan.note: Dual requirements: agenda creation + content gathering

execution_plan.description: Find next meeting with Project Alpha team
Identify Project Alpha team members
execution_plan.note: Required to 'pull in updates from their work'

execution_plan.description: Extract previous meeting notes, action items, project context
Analyze work documents, PRs, issues from Project Alpha team
execution_plan.note: Fulfills 'pull in updates from their work'

execution_plan.description: Generate agenda document with team updates and discussion topics

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can gather data in parallel
orchestration.error_handling: If work updates unavailable, include placeholder topics

compositions.prompt: Before my 1:1 with Jordan, pull together a briefing on their open tasks, recent updates, and any blockers.

execution_plan.description: Extract: target meeting (1:1 with Jordan), content needs (open tasks, updates, blockers)
Find upcoming 1:1 with Jordan
Confirm meeting type is 1:1 to tailor briefing format
Extract history: previous 1:1 notes, action items, Jordan's context
Analyze Jordan's task lists, recent commits, emails, shared docs for updates and blockers
execution_plan.note: Core content: open tasks, updates, blockers

execution_plan.description: Generate briefing document with sections: open tasks, recent updates, blockers

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel
orchestration.error_handling: If Jordan's data unavailable, include questions to ask in 1:1

compositions.prompt: Create a doc summarizing who on my team is working on what this quarter, based on their calendar and recent activity.

execution_plan.description: Extract: create document, content: team work summary, timeframe: this quarter, sources: calendar + activity
Retrieve calendar events for all team members for current quarter
Classify meetings to identify project work vs overhead
Identify team members and their meeting participation patterns
execution_plan.note: Required for 'who on my team' analysis

execution_plan.description: Analyze meeting notes, deliverables, commits, emails for 'recent activity'
Generate quarterly summary document organized by team member and project

parallelization_opportunities: step 2 can retrieve multiple calendars in parallel
step 5 can analyze multiple sources in parallel
orchestration.error_handling: If activity data incomplete, note gaps in summary

summary.notes: Fair comparison using exact same hero prompts as GPT-5. Claude Backend AI reasoning carefully analyzed each prompt without prior conversation bias. Did not use specialized Tier 3 tasks (CAN-18, CAN-22, CAN-23) or CAN-13.
